file_content.text: I thank you, and our descendants will thank you, too.
Stay back, I'm--oh, you've returned!
Look! Government bank records. Forgotten starship blueprints. Sealed mining data.... The Hutts could have funded, equipped and hidden entire fleets with this.
It's only fitting that these records serve the people of Makeb, if you reach a new home.
Now your people can use it.
Indeed. Losing our world should not mean losing ourselves.
Master Varus, that historical data would be invaluable to the Jedi Archives. Would you be willing to give us a copy?
Would you share with the Jedi?
I'm sure we'd need to remove any sensitive information first, but after that...
When the Hutts realize their Tech-Adepts failed, they'll try to get those records back. Make sure they stay classified.
Keep that information safe.
Absolutely. We can't always rely on outsiders for help.
Maybe I need to start hitting the library more often.
Hmm. I could use a fleet....
This will be a setback for Toborro and the Hutts. One of many, I promise.
The Hutts will be stopped.
From you, I believe that.
Now the Hutts will have to find their advantages elsewhere, and I can get back to doing something important.
If this is settled, I'm going.
You have my thanks. I must secure these records at once; hopefully the Tech-Adepts haven't sullied them.
Be careful out there. Makeb needs people like you.
So much history, stolen by unworthy hands.
Please, stay low. Are you sure you aren't being followed? Every one of those mercenaries is looking for me!
It's not enough for the Hutts to rip the heart out of Makeb. They would take our mind, our history, too.
Those Hutts are sending their mercenaries to steal our oldest records and antiquities, all our secrets. I must save what I can.
Makeb has much to offer the Republic. We can't let this disaster take away what makes your people unique.
Makeb's culture must survive.
Yes, and the magnitude is greater than you may think.
The evacuees, and their children, will need those records. If Makeb's history is lost, the evacuees will lose who they are.
The past informs the future.
If Makeb is doomed, its memory must be preserved.
Instead of hauling around old junk, how about pitching in with the evacuation effort? There are real people who need help.
You should be saving people.
What am I to do? My hands shake; I know nothing about first aid. But these I can save, and perhaps more.
If you're looking to get stuff offworld, no questions asked, I might be able to help you out for... oh, hardly any credits at all.
I offer great shipping rates.
So generous! Perhaps your altruism would extend even further?
I never saw Hutts as the academic type. Those records must have more than history in them.
Why do the Hutts want them?
These are mostly histories. They contain many useful scraps, but the true feast is elsewhere.
I can't see any mercenary wasting time over one old man and a pile of junk. Come to think of it, I don't have time for this, either.
No one cares.
W--wait! You could help me! These are just the beginning!
The administrative collection at our Cultural Archives has hundreds of classified documents in storage: military, political, financial. The collection's sealed, of course.
But the Hutts have hired the Tech-Adepts of Yablari: Anomid mercenaries and data experts. Even now, they're raiding the archives. Please, can you help at all?
The Hutts need to learn that not everything on Makeb is theirs for the taking. Let me take care of this.
I'm sure I can help.
Anomids aren't much for fighting at the best of times. These Tech-Adepts shouldn't be a challenge.
Tech-Adepts don't sound tough.
Clearly, you've never read about the Tech-Adepts' siege at Paigu. Their battle skills are as well-honed as their minds.
Every culture thinks their history is sacred. I can't see the Hutts getting much from the government documents of a backwater planet.
Your records aren't worth it.
See for yourself before you judge. I'll compensate you, I swear.
I don't risk my neck for free, especially not over a bunch of musty old records.
Only if there's a reward.
Rest assured, I'll pay well for whatever you can find.
These are... the most valuable documents. If only we could remove the antiquities as well.... Ah, Varus, you sentimental old fool!
What's the most important item in the Cultural Archives, apart from these documents?
What would you try to save?
Please, I mustn't be seen!
The Shipwright's Tools--you saved them after all. How marvelous! And what's this?
And it looks like you brought quite the haul.
I should focus on these documents, but if there's something I can look out for, tell me.
I could save something small.
Well, the Shipwright's Tools are on display there....
The first colonists dismantled their ships for tools, you see, and dug the first mines with them. But the documents have more strategic value.
I can't save anything if you keep me hanging around.
Just let me leave.
Yes, yes, you're right.
Of course, the Tech-Adepts will be searching for those documents, too. Be sure not to underestimate them.
